abstract:
This case study investigates how well secondary preservice teachers are prepared to
use technology in teaching in China. The study focuses on a teacher education
program that is a representative of many of those in mid-sized Chinese universities. It
examines participantsâ€™ experiences with, perspectives of, and expectations about the
use of technology and the training they are receiving in this area. Data collected
through survey and interviews indicate that research participants have similar
perspectives regarding the use of technology in teaching and the integration of
technology in teacher education as their counterparts elsewhere. They reported an
overall low level of ability to use technology and shared some concerns with the
technology training they received from the teacher education program.
